actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Rules. H. Rept. 101-1.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 1.
DEBATE - Mr. Pepper was recognized for one hour of debate. Pursuant to his unanimous consent request, an additional thirty minutes of debate time was allotted to be equally divided and controlled.

CONSIDERATION OF MEASURE - By unanimous consent the question on agreeing to the provisions of H.Res. 84 will be divided in order to allow a separate vote on each of the three titles contained in the resolution.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one and one-half hours of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to Title I, as modified, of the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to Title II of the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to Title III of the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: To establish the Select Committee on Hunger, the Select Committee on Children, Youth and Families, and the Select Committee on Narcotics Abuse and Control.

summary.text: Title I: Select Committee on Hunger - Establishes in the House of Representatives the Select Committee on Hunger to conduct a continuing comprehensive study of the problems of hunger and malnutrition. Title II: Select Committee on Children, Youth, and Families - Establishes the Select Committee on Children, Youth, and Families to conduct a continuing comprehensive study and review of the problems of children, youth, and families. Title III: Select Committee on Narcotics Abuse and Control - Establishes the Select Committee on Narcotics Abuse and Control to conduct a continuing oversight and review of the problems of narcotics, drug, and polydrug abuse and control.

titles.title: To establish the Select Committee on Hunger, the Select Committee on Children, Youth and Families, and the Select Committee on Narcotics Abuse and Control.
